name: Monte Carmelo Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and myself have just returned from staying a week in this hotel and we can thoroughly recommend it. It is very central, and yet very quiet at night. Practically no noise at all at night, which is amazing for Spain! It is because we have experienced noise levels above average in other central hotels in Spain that we chose this hotel, which is just a short walk across the river, and even though my husband is slightly incapacitated, the walk was no trouble to him. The hotel itself was also very quiet. The hotel does not seem to have walk in showers, so my husband had to climb into the bath to have a shower, which could be a problem for someone more incapacitated. However it was a low bath, so that helped. Everything worked in the room. Not a huge room but sufficient for our needs. Staff were wonderful, charming and helpful and very good English. We had a very cheap continental breakfast at 8.41 euros for 2 people which was just fine. There is a cycle hire ramp just near the hotel if you want to cycle everywhere. Great fun for the fit! There are a few great places to eat just around the corner, and great shops in all the streets near the hotel. It is very close to where they hold the April Feria. We can really recommend this lovely hotel to anyone.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, very helpful with tips about where to go, where to eat well, and help with my Spanish.
likes.disliked: — Would have liked a bigger room, and a walk in shower, but the cheap price was worth it.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Monte Carmelo from the 29th of feb to the 3th of march 2008 , weather was extraordinary , blue sky and 31` during all 4 days.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel at a good bargain

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean , big room & bathroom , salon
likes.disliked: — Could hear people talk through the walls , average breakfast ( that`s my taste)

reviews.text: When we booked this hotel we were a bit scared because it was rated as a 3+ star hotel and it turned out to be a very good bargain.You get a lot for what you payed for ,who needs more , go for it :).
reviews.title: Friendly staff but small room

likes.disliked: — Room was small and minimally furnished.

reviews.text: It`s location is good , 3 mins walk from the "plaza de cuba" and another 2 mins from the center of sevilla. So you can walk easy to the main area or take a bus at the plaza de cuba , it will cost you 0.8 euros and will bring you anywhere you want.
reviews.title: really good centrally placed hotel

likes.liked: — the price and what good value it was. The breakfasts were pretty good too
likes.disliked: — needed slightly better air conditioning which you could control yourself

reviews.text: The hotel was very clean , all through the entrance , salon , dining room and most importantly so were the rooms.The 2 bedroom rooms were very nice and big with a big bathroom. We could hear people talk through the walls so isolation wasn`t top or maybe we just weren`t meant to get the quietest place in the hotel :).
reviews.title: Great value hotel

reviews.text: Convenient location, across the river and 10 mins walk from where the attractions are. The area around the hotel comes alive after 5pm, and one can get decent restaurants, supermarts and shops around.
reviews.title: Good convenient location. Value for the price

reviews.text: The hotel staff has a basic command of english which is sufficient to get you by, but for more complex enquires or requests, I had found it difficult for them to understand my request.
reviews.title: Great Location Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service and friendliness varies. Managed to get a rental car booking via the front desk. Not the best rate but efficient and professional. The hotel garage is tight with many pillars with a very steep ramp down...so take care when parking (cost 12 euros to park overnight).
reviews.title: Ideal choice for short central stay near centre with parking

likes.liked: — clean, spacious rooms, parking, proximity to centre, internet, helpful man on reception!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in hotel is buffet and pretty good for the price. If you are thinking of eating outside the hotel for breakfast, there are small cafes around the hotel which offer basic coffee and pastries.
reviews.title: great choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rate is good for the location of the hotel. Do not come with too high expectations and you will enjoy the hotel.
reviews.title: Average Hotel, great location

description: Located in the district of Los Remedios, this is the oldest of all our hotels in Seville (Spain).It has a welcoming atmosphere, and is near the historic centre and Isle of la Cartuja, surrounded by the shopping district.The hotel has 68 rooms (rooms with twin beds, double beds, three beds and adjoining rooms) all with wooden floors. Free WiFi, parking facilities, pillows menu and rooms for women executives.Hotel Monte Carmelo is situated 10 minutes on foot from the historic quarter of Seville, in an area with a large concentration of shops, offices and public institutions such as the Regional Government of Andalusia.This location makes our hotel an ideal place to conduct business or visit the city for pleasure.
